etymology.description: 肉(肉) (ròu, "flesh") + 殿(殿) (diàn, "hall") = flesh of the lower body -> variant form of 臀(臀) (tún, "buttocks")
etymology.interpretation: The character 臋 is a variant of 臀 with the same components, where 肉(肉) ("flesh") indicates the part of the body and 殿(殿) provides the phonetic component to denote something related to the flesh, particularly the buttocks.
